version_description:
Hi PhotoPillers!

It took us a bit more than expected but here you have it:

- Synchronization between iPhone and iPad using iCloud. Just go to “Settings” in the menu “My stuff” and enable sync!
- New Backup button to easily create a backup file with your Plans and Points of Interest. You’ll find it also in the menu “My stuff”.

As always, contact us via info@photopills.com if you need help or want to send us your feedback, good or bad, we love both!

Imagine.Plan.Shoot.!

Hi PhotoPillers!

It took us a bit more than expected but here you have it:

- Synchronization between iPhone and iPad using iCloud. Just go to “Settings” in the menu “My stuff” and enable sync!
- New Backup button to easily create a backup file with your Plans and Points of Interest. You’ll find it also in the menu “My stuff”.

As always, contact us via info@photopills.com if you need help or want to send us your feedback, good or bad, we love both!

Imagine.Plan.Shoot.!

Hi PhotoPillers!

Now PhotoPills allows:

- To manually calibrate the augmented reality views when the compass of the iPhone/iPad provides wrong data.
- Never miss a shot again! Now you can add an event to the calendar directly from Plans (My Stuff), Planner, Sun and Moon pills. Just tap the action button and choose “Add to Calendar”.
- Go to the Settings (My stuff) and choose whether you want to refer the azimuth data to magnetic north or true north. Usually we work with the azimuths referred to true north. But if you have a good field compass, you might prefer to work with the magnetic north.
- New cameras: Sony Alpha 7 II; Leica M (Typ 262); Nikon D5, D500; Canon PowerShot SX420 IS, SX540 HS, ELPH 180, ELPH 190 IS, ELPH 360 HS; Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS60 (DMC-TZ80), DMC-ZS100 (DMC-TZ100); Olympus Stylus Tough TG-870

Thanks for your support, we’ll keep improving!

Imagine.Plan.Shoot.

Hi PhotoPillers!

Now PhotoPills allows:

- To manually calibrate the augmented reality views when the compass of the iPhone/iPad provides wrong data.
- Never miss a shot again! Now you can add an event to the calendar directly from Plans (My Stuff), Planner, Sun and Moon pills. Just tap the action button and choose “Add to Calendar”.
- Go to the Settings (My stuff) and choose whether you want to refer the azimuth data to magnetic north or true north. Usually we work with the azimuths referred to true north. But if you have a good field compass, you might prefer to work with the magnetic north.
- New cameras: Sony Alpha 7 II; Leica M (Typ 262); Nikon D5, D500; Canon PowerShot SX420 IS, SX540 HS, ELPH 180, ELPH 190 IS, ELPH 360 HS; Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS60 (DMC-TZ80), DMC-ZS100 (DMC-TZ100); Olympus Stylus Tough TG-870

Thanks for your support, we’ll keep improving!

Imagine.Plan.Shoot.

Hi PhotoPillers,

This update is specially interesting for those of you who do both photography and cinema.

- Now, all the calculators allow you to set cameras used in filmmaking like Arri, Red, Vision Research Phantom and Blackmagic. If you use a camera that is not on the list, do not hesitate to email us via info@photopills.com and we'll add it in the next update.
- iOS 8 Bug fixed. It occurred when adding an event to the calendar.
- Other cameras added: Canon EOS 1D X Mark II, EOS 100D (EOS Rebel SL1); Sony Alpha a6300, Cyber-shot DSC-QX100, Cyber-shot DSC-QX30; Nikon Coolpix A10, Coolpix A100; Fujifilm XP90, X-E2S, X-Pro2, X70; Leica X-U (Typ 113); Olympus PEN-F

Finally, we’d like to thank Jordi Planell and Juanjo Serrano for helping us with this version ;)

We’ll keep improving!

We’ll keep improving!

Hi PhotoPillers!

We’re super happy to introduce you the PhotoPills Awards :)

* The place you become a Legend
Because we know the huge amount of time, energy and love you put in your photos. We want to HONOR them, SHOW them to the world, and REWARD you with up to $6,600 in cash prizes.

* How it works
It’s Easy and Free! Just submit your most creative photos directly from the new Awards button (My Stuff). And get rewarded in up to 3 categories: Night, Moon and Sun. Unlimited photos! Past photos allowed!

Get Amazing Rewards!

*Daily winners
Every day, get featured on Instagram (@photopills). At the end of the year, the 365 featured photos will be included in the PhotoPills Awards Book, joining the PhotoPillers’ legacy.

*$300 every month
Every month, in each category, we’ll choose the best photo from all the featured on Instagram. Each winner will get $100. And the author of the overall best image will get interviewed.

*Become the PhotoPiller of the Year and get $3,000
Every year, an independent jury will choose the best photo from all the featured on Instagram. The artist will become the PhotoPiller of the Year and will get $3,000.

* Many have already been awarded
To mention one, Tyler Sichelski was the first one to become the PhotoPiller of the Month, back in January 2016. Meet all the Legends inside!

Keep pushing imagination :)

We’ll keep improving!

Rafael
The Bard

P.S. New cameras added:
Canon PowerShot SX720 HS, PowerShot G7 X Mark II, EOS 80D, EOS 1300D (EOS Rebel T6); Leica T (Typ 701); Nikon DL24-500, DL18-50, DL24-85, Coolpix B700, Coolpix B500, Coolpix A900; Olympus PEN E-P5,

We’ve just fixed a problem with Augmented Reality when used on iPad Air.

Also, the following cameras have been added:
Panasonic Lumix DMC-GX85, Canon PowerShot SX620 HS, Pentax K-70, Olympus PEN E-PL7, Hasselblad X1D, Fujifilm X-T2, Sony PMW-F55

We’ll keep improving :)

Thanks!
Rafael

Hi PhotoPillers,

PhotoPills has been updated to iOS 10. Please, let us know if you guys find any bug via info@photopills.com. We’ll fix it asap!

Also, this update includes:
- FoV calculator new button: we’ve added a “To DoF” button, so you can send your settings to the Depth of Field calculator.
- Augmented Reality bug fixed: when you wanted to save an image in landscape mode.
- New cameras: Nikon Coolpix W100, D3400; Fujifilm X-A3; Canon EOS 5D Mark IV; Phase One IQ3 100MP, IQ3 80MP, IQ3 60MP, IQ3 50MP.

Thanks for your support, we’ll keep improving PhotoPills!

Rafael
The Bard

Hi PhotoPillers,

This update includes:

- Augmented Reality bug fixed. Please, update to iOS 10.1.1. A bug in the previous iOS version negatively affected the performance of the Augmented Reality views. We’re continuously working to improve the AR views, please, let us know about any issue regarding the Augmented Reality sending us an email at info@photopills.com.

- Fixes crash when adding a new calendar event in iOS 10.

- New cameras: Canon EOS M5; Casio Exilim EX-ZR5000; DxO One; Fujifilm FinePix S1, GFX 50S; Leica TL; Nikon D5600; Olympus PEN E-PL8, OM-D E-M1 Mark II; Panasonic Lumix DMC-G85 (DMC-G80), Lumix DMC-FZ2500 (FZ2000), Lumix DMC-LX10; Pentax K-S1; Phase One XF 100MP; Samsung NX2000; Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H400, Cyber-shot DSC-RX100 V, a99 II, a6500; YI M1.

We’ll keep improving!

Thanks so much for your support,

Rafael
The Bard

Hi PhotoPillers,

Get ready to plan and shoot next August 21 Total Solar Eclipse!

This new tool will help you plan any Eclipse photo idea that you may have :)

How it works:
- On the Planner, swipe the top map panels to the left.
- Tap on the button you see on the first eclipse panel.
- See all the Eclipse information on the panels and on the map.
- Move the red pin to find the right shooting spot and time :)

We'll keep improving.

Thanks!

Thanks!

- Updated to iOS 11.
- Now it's easier to move the pin! Just long press on it to move it to your shooting spot.
- Added new cameras: Nikon D850; Canon EOS 200D (Rebel SL2 / Kiss X9), EOS 6D Mark II, EOS M100; Sony Alpha a5100, Alpha QX1, Cyber-shot DSC-RX10 IV; Olympus Stylus 1, Stylus 1s, OM-D E-M10 III; Fujifilm FinePix HS50 EXR, X-E3; Leica TL2; Ricoh Theta V.

- Updated to iOS 11.
- Now it's easier to move the pin! Just long press on it to move it to your shooting spot.
- Added new cameras: Nikon D850; Canon EOS 200D (Rebel SL2 / Kiss X9), EOS 6D Mark II, EOS M100; Sony Alpha a5100, Alpha QX1, Cyber-shot DSC-RX10 IV; Olympus Stylus 1, Stylus 1s, OM-D E-M10 III; Fujifilm FinePix HS50 EXR, X-E3; Leica TL2; Ricoh Theta V.

- New improved Spot Stars calculator, that takes into account the megapixels of your camera.
- Added new cameras: Sony Alpha a3000; Nikon Coolpix P520; Olympus Stylus SP-100, Stylus SP-100EE.

- New improved Spot Stars calculator, that takes into account the megapixels of your camera.

- Bug fixes.

- Bug fixes.

- Added a Timer to the Pills menu. You'll find it next to the Timelapse calculator.
- Added a Timer to the Exposure, Timelapse, Spot Stars and Star Trails calculators.
- Bug fixes.

- Planner: map rotation allowed!
- Planner: now you can long press a time in the top panel to go directly to that time.
- Planner: Added a "Now" button in the date change form.
- Spot stars calculator: Added 2 decimals in the NPF formula result.
- New cameras: Panasonic Lumix DC-GH5SM; Fujifilm FinePix XP130, X-A5.
- Bug fixes.
If you find a bug, please, let us know via info@photopills.com.
We'll keep improving!

- Google Maps added to PhotoPills for iOS. Now, you can also use the following Google Maps types: normal, satellite, hybrid and Terrain. Change the Map Type from the Planner>"+" button on the map>map icon (swipe left the options).
- Google Elevation API supported. If you are a moonhunter and you need really accurate altitude results, this is the datasource to use. By default we use SRTM/ASTER datasets. You can select the mode you wish in Settings (Main Menu > My Stuff section > Settings).
- Bug fixes.

Please, If you find a bug (or have a suggestion), send us an email to info@photopills.com and we'll fix it as soon as possible.

We'll keep improving :)

- Google Maps added to PhotoPills for iOS. Now, you can also use the following Google Maps types: normal, satellite, hybrid and Terrain. Change the Map Type from the Planner>"+" button on the map>map icon (swipe left the options).
- Google Elevation API supported. If you are a moonhunter and you need really accurate altitude results, this is the datasource to use. By default we use SRTM/ASTER datasets. You can select the mode you wish in Settings (Main Menu > My Stuff section > Settings).
- Bug fixes.

Please, If you find a bug (or have a suggestion), send us an email to info@photopills.com and we'll fix it as soon as possible.

We'll keep improving :)

- Drone planning mode added to the Planner: Plan your drone shots comfortably on the Map. Switch it on from the new Map Settings button.
- Map Settings button added to the Planner: Allows you to choose Camera mode, Drone mode, Map type, Map layers (Sun, Moon, Milky Way, Twilights and Shadows). You decide what information you wish to see on the map. You’ll find it next to the (+) Map button, at the bottom right-hand corner.
- Sun information layers added to the Planner: Standard, path, light direction and Sun size (see on the map how big the Sun will be compared with your subject).
- Moon information layers added to the Planner: Standard, path, light direction and Moon size (see on the map how big the Moon will be compared with your subject).
- Plans and Points of interest improved: when importing a backup, existing Plans and POIs won’t be duplicated.
- Film cameras, cameras with fixed focal length or fixed aperture are now supported.
- Planner > More> Action > Maps now uses Google Maps if the app is installed to calculate the route to the red pin location. If not, it uses Apple Maps.
- When adding a Plan to the Calendar (Planner > More > Action > Calendar) it also adds a reminder one hour before the event, in addition to the one day before alarm that was already created.
- New cameras added: DJI Phantom 2 Vision, Phantom 2 Vision+, Phantom FC40, Phantom 3, Phantom 3 4K, Phantom 3 Advanced, Phantom 3 SE, Phantom 4, Phantom 4 Pro, Phantom 4 Advanced, Mavic Pro, Zenmuse X3, Zenmuse X4S, Zenmuse X5, Zenmuse X5R, Zenmuse X5S, Zenmuse Z3, Zenmuse X7, Mavic AIR, Spark; GoPro HERO, HERO2, HERO3 Black Edition, HERO3 Silver Edition, HERO3 White Edition, HERO3+ Black Edition, HERO3+ Silver Edition, HERO4, HERO+, HERO5, HERO6; Yuneec Typhoon H, Typhoon H PLUS, Breeze 4K, C23, E50, E90, CG04, CG03+, CG03; Canon EOS 4000D, EOS 2000D; Olympus PEN E-PL9; Fujifilm X-H1; Pentax K-1 Mark II; Panasonic Lumix DC-ZS200, Lumix DC-GX9, Lumix DMC-LZ40, Lumix DMC-LZ30; Sony a7 III; Film cameras: 35mm, 35mm Panoramic, Medium Format 6x7, 6x6, 6x4.5, 6x9, Large Format 4x5, 5x7, 8x10, 11x14, 16x20.
- Bug fixes.

Please, If you find a bug (or have a suggestion), send us an email to info@photopills.com and we'll fix it as soon as possible :)

- Sun information layers added to the Planner: Standard, path, light direction and Sun size (see on the map how big the Sun will be compared with your subject).
- Moon information layers added to the Planner: Standard, path, light direction and Moon size (see on the map how big the Moon will be compared with your subject).
- Plans and Points of interest improved: when importing a backup, existing Plans and POIs won’t be duplicated.
- Film cameras, cameras with fixed focal length or fixed aperture are now supported.
- Planner > More> Action > Maps now uses Google Maps if the app is installed to calculate the route to the red pin location. If not, it uses Apple Maps.
- When adding a Plan to the Calendar (Planner > More > Action > Calendar) it also adds a reminder one hour before the event, in addition to the one day before alarm that was already created.
- New cameras added: DJI Phantom 2 Vision, Phantom 2 Vision+, Phantom FC40, Phantom 3, Phantom 3 4K, Phantom 3 Advanced, Phantom 3 SE, Phantom 4, Phantom 4 Pro, Phantom 4 Advanced, Mavic Pro, Zenmuse X3, Zenmuse X4S, Zenmuse X5, Zenmuse X5R, Zenmuse X5S, Zenmuse Z3, Zenmuse X7, Mavic AIR, Spark; GoPro HERO, HERO2, HERO3 Black Edition, HERO3 Silver Edition, HERO3 White Edition, HERO3+ Black Edition, HERO3+ Silver Edition, HERO4, HERO+, HERO5, HERO6; Yuneec Typhoon H, Typhoon H PLUS, Breeze 4K, C23, E50, E90, CG04, CG03+, CG03; Canon EOS 4000D, EOS 2000D; Olympus PEN E-PL9; Fujifilm X-H1; Pentax K-1 Mark II; Panasonic Lumix DC-ZS200, Lumix DC-GX9, Lumix DMC-LZ40, Lumix DMC-LZ30; Sony a7 III; Film cameras: 35mm, 35mm Panoramic, Medium Format 6x7, 6x6, 6x4.5, 6x9, Large Format 4x5, 5x7, 8x10, 11x14, 16x20.
- Bug fixes.

Please, If you find a bug (or have a suggestion), send us an email to info@photopills.com and we'll fix it as soon as possible :)

Start planning your Sun and Moon eclipses with the Planner!

- Sun and Moon eclipse calendar and map info layer added to the Planner.
- To switch on the Eclipse information layer on the Map, just tap on the Map Settings Button (next to the + Map button). And then tap on the Eye icon next to Eclipse (from Map layers).
- From the same screen, tap on the Eclipse layer to choose the eclipse you wish to plan from the Eclipse calendar. Finally, tap on Done (top right hand corner).
- The Eclipse information will be displayed on the map. And the date of the Eclipse will be set at the Time bar.
- On the top information panels 9 and 10 (swipe left the panels above the map), you’ll find all the key Eclipse information including: type of eclipse, date and the time of the most important eclipse phases. This information is relative to the position of the Red pin.
- Watch this video to learn how to plan a total solar eclipse: https://www.photopills.com/videos/how-plan-august-21-2017-total-solar-eclipse
- New Cameras added: Xiaomi Mi Drone (4K version), Mi Drone (1080P version); Panasonic Lumix DC-TS7 (DC-FT7); Fujifilm X-T100
- Bug fixes.

Please, If you find a bug (or have a suggestion), send us an email to info@photopills.com and we'll fix it as soon as possible :)

Imagine. Plan. Shoot!

Start planning your Sun and Moon eclipses with the Planner!

- Sun and Moon eclipse calendar and map info layer added to the Planner.
- To switch on the Eclipse information layer on the Map, just tap on the Map Settings Button (next to the + Map button). And then tap on the Eye icon next to Eclipse (from Map layers).
- From the same screen, tap on the Eclipse layer to choose the eclipse you wish to plan from the Eclipse calendar. Finally, tap on Done (top right hand corner).
- The Eclipse information will be displayed on the map. And the date of the Eclipse will be set at the Time bar.
- On the top information panels 9 and 10 (swipe left the panels above the map), you’ll find all the key Eclipse information including: type of eclipse, date and the time of the most important eclipse phases. This information is relative to the position of the Red pin.
- Watch this video to learn how to plan a total solar eclipse: https://www.photopills.com/videos/how-plan-august-21-2017-total-solar-eclipse
- New Cameras added: Xiaomi Mi Drone (4K version), Mi Drone (1080P version); Panasonic Lumix DC-TS7 (DC-FT7); Fujifilm X-T100
- Bug fixes.

Please, If you find a bug (or have a suggestion), send us an email to info@photopills.com and we'll fix it as soon as possible :)

Imagine. Plan. Shoot!

- New cameras added: Canon PowerShot SX740 HS, PowerShot SX70 HS, EOS R; DJI Mavic 2 Pro, Mavic 2 Zoom; Fujifilm X-T3, GFX 50R, FinePix S9900W, FinePix S9800, XF10; Leica C-Lux, M10-P; Nikon Coolpix A300, Coolpix P1000, Z6, Z7, D3500; Panasonic Lumix DMC-GX85, Lumix DMC-GX80, Lumix DMC-GX7 Mark II, Lumix DC-LX100 II; Parrot Anafi; Sony Cyber-shot DSC-RX100 V(A), Cyber-shot DSC-RX100 VI, Cyber-shot DSC-HX95, Cyber-shot DSC-HX99; Zeiss ZX1.
- Now you can select if you want to enter the focal length with the real focal length or the 35mm equivalent.
- Bug fixes

- New cameras added: Canon PowerShot SX740 HS, PowerShot SX70 HS, EOS R; DJI Mavic 2 Pro, Mavic 2 Zoom; Fujifilm X-T3, GFX 50R, FinePix S9900W, FinePix S9800, XF10; Leica C-Lux, M10-P; Nikon Coolpix A300, Coolpix P1000, Z6, Z7, D3500; Panasonic Lumix DMC-GX85, Lumix DMC-GX80, Lumix DMC-GX7 Mark II, Lumix DC-LX100 II; Parrot Anafi; Sony Cyber-shot DSC-RX100 V(A), Cyber-shot DSC-RX100 VI, Cyber-shot DSC-HX95, Cyber-shot DSC-HX99; Zeiss ZX1.
- Now you can select if you want to enter the focal length with the real focal length or the 35mm equivalent.
- Bug fixes

- Start planning your Field of View (FoV) and Depth of Field (DoF) with the Planner!
- Field of View (FoV): Visualize the Field of View on the map of the Planner based on your camera and camera settings. Or change your Field of View directly on the map to adjust the frame and find out the focal length you need.
- Depth of Field (DoF): Visualize the Depth of Field, focus distance and the hyperfocal distance on the map of the Planner. So you know where to focus to get the DoF you need in the photo.
- How to enable the FoV or DoF tool on the map? Go to the Planner. Tap on the Map Settings button (on the map, bottom right corner, next to the “+” button). Tap on Map tool (right after Map type). And choose Field of View or Depth of Field.
- Bug fixes.

Please, If you find a bug (or have a suggestion), send us an email to info@photopills.com and we'll fix it as soon as possible :)

Imagine. Plan. Shoot!

We've improved the Planner:

- Updated the 2nd top panel of the Planner. Now it also shows the apparent height of the Sun, Moon, Milky Way arch or Galactic Center above the Black Pin terrain. Do you want to plan a Moon shot over a 20m bulding? Place the Black Pin on the building and move the time and the Red Pin so when the Moon is aligned with the Black Pin, this 2nd top panel says the moon is at 20m. This panel also shows the size (in meters or feet) that the Moon or Sun will have in the Black Pin position. Ah! and we take into account the curvature of the Earth to calculate the apparent height :)

- New Sun/Moon Planner map calculator. Easily calculate the shooting distance for a specific Sun/Moon size compared to a subject. The Planner will draw a circumference around the Black Pin showing the distance you have to place the Red Pin to get the size of the Sun/Moon you want. You can enable this tool from the Map Settings button, located on the map, next to the (+) button.

- Added an option to manually set the altitude for the Red and Black Pins. In the Planner, tap More > Altitudes to manually set the altitudes.

- When you do a long press on the center of the time bar, now it spans 15 minutes instead of 1 hour. This way you can change the time more slowly to better align the Sun, the Moon or the Milky Way.

- Added the option to use real Sun and Moon azimuth lines on the map, taking into account Earth curvature (enabled by default). Now PhotoPills will be more accurate for really long distance shots. You can switch this option off/on from the Sun/Moon layers you'll find in the Map settings button, on the map, next to the (+) button.

- Latitude and Longitude coordinates now show 6 decimal places instead of 4.

- In the Find > Sun or Find > Moon tools, now the apparent height shown in the Elevation tab (Numeric bottom option) is referred to the Yellow/Blue Pin terrain instead of Red Pin terrain. This way you don't have to do any mental calculation when planning the Sun/Moon at certain height above the ground level of your subject.

- New cameras: Canon EOS RP; Film camera 24x65 XPan, Medium Format 5x12, 6x10, 6x12, 6x17, 6x24, 6x7, 6x8; Fujifilm FinePix XP140, X-T30; GoPro HERO7; Leica D-Lux 7, M10-D, Q-P, Q2; Nikon Coolpix A1000, Coolpix B600, Coolpix L830, Coolpix P600; Panasonic Lumix DC-FZ1000 II, Lumix DC-S1, Lumix DC-S1R, Lumix DC-ZS80 (DC-TZ95); Ricoh G900, WG-6; Sony a6400; Xiaomi YI 4K.

- Bug fixes

Please, If you find a bug (or have a suggestion), send us an email to info@photopills.com and we'll fix it as soon as possible :)

- New Meteor Shower Pill: Plan your Meteor Showers photos in the field. Includes a Meteor Shower calendar, local peak dates and times, visibility and quality, radiant information and position in the Augmented Reality view.
- New Planner’s Meteor Shower layer: Plan your Meteor Showers photos from home. Visualize the radiant path on the map and on the Night Augmented Reality view.
- New cameras: Canon EOS C700, EOS M6 Mark II, EOS 90D, EOS M200; Fujifilm X-A7, X-Pro3; Nikon Z50; Olympus OM-D E-M5 III; Panasonic Lumix DC-S1H; Sony Venice, PDW-680, PDW-F800, PDW-850, PXW-FS7 II,P XW-Z150, NEX-FS700R, Cyber-shot DSC-RX100 VII, a6600, a6100, a9 II; TinyMOS nano1

- If you have a phone that includes more than 1 camera, the Augmented Reality views now allow you to select which camera you wish to use (focal length). It's really useful for example to use the Wide Angle camera when planning Milky Way photos.
- iPhone camera models have been added to the camera list.
- Cameras added: Canon EOS 1500D (Rebel T7), EOS 1D X Mark III; DJI Mavic Mini; FIMI X8 SE; Leica SL2; Nikon Coolpix P950, D780; GoPro HERO8; iPhones.

- Bug fixes.

- When planning a photo in the field using the Augmented Reality view (AR), tapping "Action > Save image" now saves the screenshot as a geotagged photo. It saves the location, the date and the time of the AR plan. This way you can later open it with the Planner by tapping "Load > Geotagged image" and place the Red Pin right in the spot you took the AR screenshot. The date and time will also be set at the date and time of the plan you did using the AR view.
- New cameras: Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera 6K; Canon EOS 850D (EOS Rebel T8i / Kiss X10i); DJI Osmo Action; Fujifilm X-T200, X100V, X-T4; Leica M10 Monochrom; Nikon D6; Olympus OM-D E-M1 Mark III, PEN E-PL10; Ricoh WG-70.
- Bug fixes.

Please, If you find a bug (or have a suggestion), send us an email to info@photopills.com and we'll fix it as soon as possible :)

- When planning a photo in the field using the Augmented Reality view (AR), tapping "Action > Save image" now saves the screenshot as a geotagged photo. It saves the location, the date and the time of the AR plan. This way you can later open it with the Planner by tapping "Load > Geotagged image" and place the Red Pin right in the spot you took the AR screenshot. The date and time will also be set at the date and time of the plan you did using the AR view.
- New cameras: Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera 6K; Canon EOS 850D (EOS Rebel T8i / Kiss X10i); DJI Osmo Action; Fujifilm X-T200, X100V, X-T4; Leica M10 Monochrom; Nikon D6; Olympus OM-D E-M1 Mark III, PEN E-PL10; Ricoh WG-70.
- Bug fixes.

- In the Planner, when you use the compass button you find in the (+) map button (next to the lock icon), now the map rotates relative to your position, not relative to the Red Pin position. This way it’s easier to figure out how to get to the Red Pin Position.
